meanings.definition: (verb) to walk or move with a quick, lively step
meanings.sent1: She ankled down the street to catch the bus.
meanings.sent2: The children ankled happily through the park.
meanings.sent3: The puppy ankled around the yard, chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The dancer ankled across the stage with grace and precision.
meanings.sent5: He ankled with determination, eager to reach his destination.

meanings.sent1: Her ankled feet looked delicate in the sandals.
meanings.sent2: The ankled ballerina had a graceful posture.
meanings.sent3: The ankled vase stood elegantly on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: The ankled model showcased the latest fashion trends.
meanings.sent5: The ankled figure skater glided effortlessly on the ice.

meanings.definition: (noun) the joint connecting the foot with the leg
meanings.sent1: He felt a sharp pain in his ankled after the fall.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined her swollen ankled carefully.
meanings.sent3: The ankled of the table was reinforced for stability.
meanings.sent4: The ankled of the robot allowed it to move smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The ankled of the bridge creaked under the weight of the cars.
